demos.dag-consensus.auto.click_tips_to_v: Click tips to view details ΓÇó Shift+Click to select as parents
demos.dag-consensus.auto.consensus_inspi: Consensus inspired by repeated random sampling; includes DAG-like structures in parts of its design.
demos.dag-consensus.auto.dagbased_ledger: DAG-based ledger designed for IoT-style micro-transactions and high throughput without traditional blocks.
demos.dag-consensus.auto.dagstyle_struct: DAG-style structures also appear in distributed systems for causal ordering and conflict resolution.
demos.dag-consensus.auto.devicetodevice_: Device-to-device payments or data exchange benefit from low fees and parallel confirmations.
demos.dag-consensus.auto.directed_acycli: Directed Acyclic Graph consensus - transactions reference previous ones, forming a web instead of a chain
demos.dag-consensus.auto.each_transactio: Each transaction references 1-2 previous transactions (usually tips). This creates a web structure instead of a single chain.
demos.dag-consensus.auto.many_projects_e: Many projects explore DAGs for parallel transaction ordering and faster confirmations.
demos.dag-consensus.auto.once_a_transact: Once a transaction has enough cumulative weight (ΓëÑ3 references), it becomes confirmed and immutable.
demos.dag-consensus.auto.shiftclick_node: Shift+Click nodes in DAG to select
demos.dag-consensus.auto.try_click_tips_: Try: Click tips to select parents, then add your transaction. Watch weight propagate and confirmations happen!
demos.dag-consensus.auto.weight_increase: Weight increases as more transactions reference it (directly or indirectly). Higher weight = more consensus.
demos.dag-consensus.auto.when_many_users: When many users create transactions simultaneously, DAGs can confirm in parallel instead of queuing behind a single block leader.
demos.dag-consensus.auto.will_autoselect: Will auto-select tips if none chosen
